title: The Building Blocks to Scale-Up a Customer Success Organization
description: In this video, watch as Allyson White, Principal and lead of our Customer Success Center of Excellence, explains our Building Blocks of Customer Success framework.  She breaks customer success into three key phases and six critical capabilities.

title: Webinar: Close the Gap with Your Buyers
description:
There is a trust gap in the B2B buying process. According to research TrustRadius' 2019 B2B Buying Disconnect report, vendor resources (like marketing collateral and sales reps) are the least influential of all available resources. 

In plain English, buyers don’t trust your marketing and they don’t trust your sales team. Yet buyers trust their peers. In fact, reviews are the second most used source of information for B2B buyers. How can you tap into trust and social proof to accelerate pipeline and drive sales?

title: Finding & Acquiring The Right Leads For Your Business

We will demonstrate the various features available to reinforce our chosen methodology using Salesforce's newer Lightning interface (though the majority of the concepts apply to the older Classic interface as well).

The Insight IGNITE Innovation Roundtable series provides C-level technology and digital leaders from large global companies the opportunity to learn, network with peers, and engage with emerging software market leaders. 

In May 2019, the IGNITE team hosted a thought leadership and networking event in Nice, France with several portfolio companies, inspiring keynote speakers and enterprise leaders.

Just like Google Maps changed the game for navigation, the WalkMe Digital Adoption Platform (DAP) provides the same capability for software by removing training as a barrier to agility.

title: Marketing Center of Excellence: Episerver Digital Marketing Hub Campaign Highlights

description: Every business has customers that acknowledge in a deep and tangible way the value created through working together. These value based relationships are extremely difficult to develop, but have a huge impact on long-term customer success.

title: Women's Tech Leadership Summit
description:
Disruption. Change.  In an age of unprecedented business and societal shifts, tech companies are redefining the way we work and live. Insight Partners invests in, and partners with, companies leading this change. Our companies want to be more diverse, inclusive workplaces offering equal opportunity for all.

This was the inspiration for Insight Partners’ inaugural Women’s Tech Leadership Summit. The summit was a celebration of how far women have come in the tech industry, and an exploration of what all of us can do to be the “faces of change”. We were truly inspired by the capable and driven leaders who joined us from around the world.

description: In a competitive talent market, it’s critical to demonstrate that the company cares about its employees.

description: Top candidates need to feel compelled to apply for your open roles. Sophisticated, modern talent acquisition teams use analytics and a marketing approach to achieve this.

description: In this video, Katy Ganguli from Insight Partners describes why it's imperative for hiring leaders to be trained and take responsibility during the hiring process.

description: In September '19, Insight Partners invited a number of our Israeli portfolio companies to a forum focused on IPO preparation, specifically tailored to companies with significant operations in Israel.

title: Mastering Your Pricing Strategy as Your Company Scales
description: Price underpins so many strategic decisions and it's important that businesses have a strategy that is responsive, built on feedback and data from customers, and scaled up as the company grows. Listen to Insight VP of Pricing Strategy, James Wood, discuss pricing strategies in this informative webinar.

title: Cybersecurity Linchpin of the Digital Enterprise Webinar
Pricing: Limiting Decision Fatigue
description: In this video, Insight's Managing Director, Rachel Geller, explains why presenting customers with too many options can be detrimental.

title: Webinar: Move Mountains with Marketing Analytics
description: Executives expect marketers to quantify the return on their marketing investments.  Marketers need to understand what’s working and what’s not so they can adjust, test and optimize their strategy, tactics and resources to continuously improve.  Marketing analytics can move mountains when everyone in the organization understands what the analytics mean, how to use them, and trusts in their veracity. You can have the best marketing technology, the greatest minds sifting data, and the most dazzling charts and graphs — but until the organization truly embraces marketing analytics as the everyday common language to drive marketing and sales improvement, the return on investment in marketing analytics people, process and technology will be low.

description:
From the type of people you want to recruit to how the different functions of your company interact with one another, your workspace can help you drive your business forward. With the rapid change in "how we work", the question of "where we work" has become more important than ever in identifying new avenues of growth and attracting top talent.

Watch this webinar hosted in partnership with T3 Advisors.

description: In this Scale-Up Hack, Rachel Geller, Insight Managing Director, outlines two principles that showcase the importance of strategically increasing your prices.

title: About Insight Partners
description: In 1995, we bet on our hunch that software would change the game. We’ve since partnered with hundreds of executives who’ve transformed and shaped industries, changing the way people live and do business. Insight’s approach is straightforward and results-driven. We deploy our three core pillars - scale, focus, and experience - to help companies capture value and generate long-term business success.

title: Webinar: Amplify Your Press Wins
description: Getting media coverage is great, but high growth companies shouldn't stop at just adding a link or a logo on their websites. To truly be effective, marketing leaders need to employ a strategy that allows them to gain the most mileage out of your press coverage and be able to demonstrate ROI. Watch this webinar hosted by BAM Communications, a tech PR communications agency.

title: OpenCloud Summit Fireside Chat with Sohaib Abbasi
description:
Fireside Chat with Sohaib Abbasi, former CEO Informatica and board member at McAfee, New Relic & RedHat

Moderated by: Dharmesh Thakker, Battery Ventures

title: Are Your Prepared for the California Consumer Privacy Act?
description:
Companies needed to quickly get educated and prepare for the GDPR regulation that went into effect in May 2018. Now, the time has come again to prepare for the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), which is the nation's first comprehensive consumer privacy law that will be effective January 1, 2020. 

To host this educational webinar, Insight has partnered with Gary Kibel, a Partner at the law firm of Davis & Gilbert LLP.

title: CEO Spotlight: Matthew Schiltz of Conga
description: The CEO of Conga, an Insight portfolio company, shares how the company has scaled over the years and how their growth has created opportunities for their employees, customers, and local economy.

title: CEO Perspectives: Creating a Category for Disruptive Tech
description:
What happens when you're selling a disruptive technology that doesn't fit into a known category,  Gartner MQ, or a line in the budget? How do you get other businesses to understand the problem you’re solving? Similar to a number of Insight portfolio companies, this was a challenge that Yoobic had to face as a new player in the retail industry.

In this webinar, the CEO of Yoobic and the CEO of Atreo will discuss how category design is a crucial part of disruptive technology branding.

title: Insight IGNITE 2020 Vision, Are You Ready?
Founder Feature: Mario Ciabarra of Quantum Metric
description: In 2018, Insight Partners made a $25M Series A investment into Quantum Metric, a Digital Intelligence Platform that gives cross-functional teams real-time, out-of-the-box insights to easily and proactively identify, prioritize and act, so you can maximize the business impact of your web and native apps.  In this video, Mario Ciabarra, Founder & CEO of Quantum Metrics, shares his experience as a serial entrepreneur and the inspiration behind Quantum Metric.

title: GO: Insight's Platform for ScaleUp Software Portfolio Companies
description: Insight Partners is excited to announce that we have relaunched GO, a private platform that provides our ScaleUp portfolio companies with the network, resources, and opportunities that they need to grow.

title: Webinar: Sharpen Your Public Speaking Skills
description:
Successful leaders know that need to frequently sharpen their skills to keep pace with industry trends and the competition. Public speaking is no exception.

When an opportunity arises to give a keynote speech, be interviewed by the media, or present in front of a Board of Directors, you should feel confident in your ability be eloquent. 

Join us for an interactive webinar led by Stephanie Silverman, presentation coach to some of the most recognized companies in the world.

title: OpenCloud Summit -- OpenCloud Presentation by Dharmesh Thakker, Battery Ventures
OpenCloud Summit -- Cloudy with a Chance of Money
description: "Cloudy with a Chance of Money: Driving Monetization in a Cloud-Native World" with Sahir Azam, MongoDB and Yvonne Wassenaar, Puppet. Moderated by Nick Shevelyov from Silicon Valley Bank at Battery Ventures and SVB's OpenCloud Summit

title: OpenCloud Summit -- Fireside Chat with Paul Cormier, Red Hat
description: Fireside chat with Paul Cormier, Red Hat moderated by Max Schireson, Battery Ventures, Former CEO of MongoDB

title: Webinar: How to Harness User Reviews
description: The B2B software buyer journey is undergoing a consumerization shift, just as enterprise software itself is. This means that buyers are increasingly doing more research online before they even speak to a vendor. Every month, millions of people research, compare and select software and services on G2.

title: Webinar: Marketer’s Guide to Scaling without Compromising Customer Experience
description:
If you do marketing at a startup or growth-stage company, then you know that scale and agility are necessary for success. But how do you keep up with the demands of a high-growth business, align your teams and deliver a fantastic customer experience that supports your goals? 

This was the challenge Rich Copenhagen, Sr. Manager, Marketing Operations at Sysdig, an Insight portfolio company, set out to solve. With a combination of the right processes and technology, Rich has empowered the rest of the marketing team to execute and measure campaigns with fewer bottlenecks, while delivering a seamless customer experience that’s helped increase pipeline growth attributed to content marketing.

title: Quantify, Prioritize, and Measure Digital Customer Experience
description: On average, businesses typically leave 15% of revenue on the table due to negative customer experiences. Large global companies that can deliver phenomenal digital customer experiences are the ones who will succeed. Aspiration Bank is utilizing Quantum Metric, a digital experience intelligence platform as their microscope to identify, quantify, prioritize and measure where their biggest opportunities are on their digital platform.

title: Webinar: Tactics for Scaling Marketing Teams to Drive Growth
description:
You have raised capital, gained early traction in the market and now you need to fuel growth for your business by building awareness and converting leads. Resources are still constrained, and you have to deploy your budget and team strategically to hit your targets. 

In this webinar, watch Salesforce share strategies, tools and tactics to better optimize your marketing efforts. Small and growing business marketing leaders will share best practices and secrets to successful tactics to create leads and pipeline in 2020.

title: Announcing Battery Ventures Fund XIII & Fund XIII Side Fund
3 Signs It’s Time to Invest in Scalable Back Office Solutions
description:
Growth puts big demands on the finance team to prove out the revenue model, forecast the future, and manage cash and revenue.  What should be your trigger to automate your financial and subscription billing systems?  What should be the key criteria of success for the project? 

Watch our webinar led by Mike Etheridge, VP of Finance of Arena Solutions, and David Appel, Head of the Subscription Vertical at Sage Intacct.

title: The Imposter Phenomenon in High Achieving Women
description:
Those who experience imposter syndrome often believe they are inferior to others or have faked their way into positions despite impressive accomplishments. Up to 70% of women and men, especially high-achievers, experience imposter syndrome at some point in their career. This false belief system leads some people to self-sabotage, turn down career and growth opportunities, and limit their own career trajectories.

Join Paulette Rao MCC BCC, Executive Coach as she explains imposter syndrome and shares constructive ways you can begin to overcome this negative thought cycle. This workshop is designed to help you identify and normalize imposter thoughts and learn an effective strategy to cope with this fearful thinking.

title: How Are Insight Portfolio Companies Solving D&I?
description: We asked several women in our portfolio what their companies are doing to solve diversity and inclusion. See how Insight Partners' community is making a global impact!

title: Webinar: Move Your Dot in the Next Magic Quadrant
description:
Consider this scenario: The Magic Quadrant your company participated in just published. Your dot placement is okay, but not where you wanted it to be. Your executives and product team want to know what you’re going to do to place better next year…

Have you been here before? What is your plan to move the dot? 

For this webinar, Insight has partnered with Spotlight to discuss how to make the biggest impact in your next evaluation report.

title: Communicating & Organizational Response During Coronavirus Webinar
description: In times of crisis, communication is key. That's why we have partnered with Edelman, a global communications firm with expertise in crisis management and multi-stakeholder communications. The Edelman Global Coronavirus Task Force has been working directly with the World Health Organization (WHO) on guidelines and best practice for organizations communicating to stakeholders during the coronavirus outbreak.

title: John Couch, VP Product Design at Hulu at Insight IGNITE Innovation Roundtable in Arizona 2019
description: John Couch, VP Product Design at Hulu and the author of ‘The Art of Creative Rebellion’ gives an overview of his keynote during our Roundtable in Arizona back in September 2019 featuring insights on Building a Design-Driven Culture

title: Chris Corrado, COO & CIO of the London Stock Exchange at the IGNITE Roundtable in Israel 2019
description: Chris Corrado COO & CIO of the London Stock Exchange gave a keynote during our Roundtable in Israel and shared how he’s transformed the company into a  data analytics business, remaining innovative within the enterprise & the 10 commandments he lives by.

title: Insight IGNITE Innovation Roundtable in Israel 2019
description: In October 2019, industry thought leaders and G2000 C-suite executives gathered in Jerusalem, Israel for Insight IGNITE’s most recent innovation roundtable, where they shared and learned insights on driving digital transformation from the top down.

title: Interview with Andy Glover, Director of Delivery Engineering at Netflix
description: Andy Glover, Director of Delivery Engineering at Netflix, recently sat down DROdio, CEO of Insight Partners portfolio company Armoury to talk about why Netflix created Spinnaker, what problem it solves for Netflix, and how Spinnaker helps companies deliver software with more safety and velocity.

title: Aaptiv's CEO Presents: The Key to a Happy & Healthy Workforce
description: Now more than ever, it is important for company leaders to put their people first and make their mental and physical wellbeing a top priority. On April 14th, Insight hosted a webinar with Ethan Agarwal, Founder & CEO of Aaptiv, which you can watch above. In the video, you will learn how you can create a workplace culture that enables and empowers your team to achieve their wellness goals. To help make these “uncertain times” feel less stressful, Ethan also shares best practices on how to integrate mental and physical wellness into a "work from home" lifestyle and ensure that your employee benefits support your team members.

title: Webinar: Defensive Pricing During COVID-19
description:
On May 4th, 2020, Insight hosted with Eddie Hartman, Partner at Simon-Kucher and Partners, as he discusses critical frameworks for defending your revenue during COVID-19, and accelerating into the economic recovery.

This webinar will cover specific pricing and retention strategies, drawing on data from the 2000 and 2008 crises. The goals are to protect your company’s revenues during the current crisis, and to set your business up to succeed when recovery comes – even if the recovery is non-linear.

title: Tactical Tips for Hosting a Virtual Conference
description:
If you have ever hosted a conference, you know firsthand the amount of time, effort, and money that goes into hosting a successful event. Now imagine that after months of planning and the date of your conference approaching, the COVID-19 pandemic hits and you are faced with a difficult choice — cancel your conference or completely shift gears and go virtual.

In a short period of time, two Insight portfolio companies, WalkMe and Tricentis, decided to embrace innovation and host their phsyical conferences digitally. In this webinar, Kira Mondrus-Moyal, SVP Global Marketing of Tricentis, and Luna Froumine, Head of International Marketing at WalkMe, will share tactical tips on how to host a digital event at scale. They will discuss everything from hosting platforms to engagement strategies. To give an overview of the state of events during COVID-19, we have also invited Ben Hindman, Co-Founder and CEO of Splash.

title: Insights From the Author of "An Elegant Puzzle: Systems of Engineering Management"
Webinar: Save on Infrastructure Costs Using Innovative Technology
description:
Now more than ever, it is important that technical leaders of ScaleUp companies focus on improving resource utilization, optimizing workloads, and investing in forward thinking startups. 

On May 26th, join our webinar hosted by two recent editions to our portfolio, Carbon Relay and Granulate. These two portfolio companies will present new and innovative approaches for infrastructure cost savings and optimization.

title: Pivot Your Product Strategy Based on New Realities
description:
Many have referred the COVID-19 crisis as "The Great Pause" and while some aspects of life have slowed down, that does not mean that your product strategy should too. 

Insight has partnered with Crosslake to host this webinar to help you reimagine your Product Strategy based on the new ‘on the ground’ realities. We will help you to engage with your stakeholders to understand the new direction for your business and how to clarify these directives. Using a pre-defined framework, we walk you through how to transform this new direction into reality and explain how to provide optionality including an impact assessment on your product offerings and your product organization. We will close by sharing an M&A evaluation checklist for your investors.

title: Innovative Trends in HR
Tactics to Generate Leads with Conversational Marketing
description:
In an environment without tradeshows and event, digital campaigns have increased in importance for demand generation. Meanwhile, marketers miss out on leads when target buyers actively browse the site, consume content, and leave without any active engagement.

Many portfolio companies have benefitted from using chatbots like Drift. Join us for a discussion, including tactical examples of best practices, about how you can implement conversational marketing.

title: Welcome to the Pricing Community
Battery Ventures - WebPT
description: Co-founder of WebPT Heidi Jannenga and CEO Nancy Ham talk about their process of finding a VC and why they chose to work with Battery Ventures and Chelsea Stoner.

title: In Your Shoes: Founder of Automattic
Betsy Atkins on The Role of the Board in Managing Crisis
description:
One of the key responsibilities of a company's board is to lead through a crisis. While not an easy task, crisis management and communication are integral to protecting shareholders, employees, and customers.

Join Betsy Atkins, author, serial CEO and Board member in a fireside chat with Hilary Gosher, managing director at Insight Partners, as they discuss Betsy’s perspective on shaping boardroom strategy and navigating crisis situations.

Betsy’s experience spans hostile takeovers, fraud, cyber security breaches, #metoo, SEC investigations, and demand side shocks. She will share insider tips on how to get a Board seat, the role of Boards in the current environment, and the value of diversity.

title: In Your Shoes: CEO of Enverus
description:
Insight Partners hosts the "In Your Shoes" fireside chat series to provide our portfolio CEOs with leadership insights and a forum to share ideas and ask advice. These digital events feature experienced CEOs from high growth ScaleUps willing to openly share their leadership challenges.

On July 16, 2020 Insight Managing Director, Anika Agarwal hosted a fireside chat with the CEO of Enverus, Jeff Hughes.

Jeff joined Enverus in 2016. Since then, sales have grown 4.5x and profits have increased from 14% to 45%, with 16 acquisitions completed that expand solutions and diversify across three business units Oil & Gas Analytics, Trading & Risk and Business Automation. With more than 6000 customers across the energy value chain, Enverus has grown to be the largest and fastest SaaS company serving the energy industry.

Jeff’s background includes a 20-year track record of driving market share and profit growth at SaaS businesses, ranging from startups to Fortune 500 corporations. His expertise  …

title: Cost Optimization - Tackling Your Technical Costs
description:
This webinar, hosted in partnership with Crosslake, will provide a framework for planning and executing sustainable cost optimizations in line with your business strategy and goals. We will help you identify cost reduction and productivity opportunities. Our roadmap for value creation will allow you to act in the interest of your immediate future while retaining customers and preparing for the “new normal.”

By aligning your product roadmap, organization, cloud, architecture, and development processes, you can confidently optimize your costs in a way that strengthens your business and prepares you for the future, all while supporting your business strategy.

title: From SEO to Paid Media: Building a Fully Integrated Campaign
description:
This webinar, hosted in partnership with Wpromote, will provide a tactical framework to fully integrate your SEO and Content Marketing campaigns to increase lead generation and drive meaningful pipeline for your organization.



By analyzing your marketing data, prioritizing opportunities based on predicted impact, and producing content that converts, you can build an organic infrastructure that will elevate the performance of your campaigns across both paid and earned channels.

title: How to Select an HRIS
description:
One of the most common questions we get from high growth companies is: what is the right HRIS system for an organization our size?

So, how do you know when it’s time to move from Excel and paper forms to a more robust way to manage your people – when is it time to invest in an HRIS (Human Resource Information System)?

title: The Disruption of the Cyber Threat Landscape
description: Insight IGNITE: Leaders of Digital Change Roundtable Series: WFH The Disruption Of The Cyber Threat Landscape

title: How to Attract & Retain Women in Revenue Leadership
description:
Sales and marketing are great career choices for women. So why aren’t there more female leaders? Insight Partners has teamed up with "Women in Revenue" to host a panel discussion around a research report that they recently published on how to attract and retain women in revenue leadership.

Topics of Discussion:
- Career roadblocks for women in revenue roles
- What women leaders value most
- Advice for career advancement
- What companies can do to attract more women leaders
- What men can do as allies and sponsors

This expert panel will be moderated by Tracy Eiler, CMO of InsideView and Founding Member of Women in Revenue, and will include several female leaders from Insight's portfolio.

Speakers:
- Christy McDonald, CRO of CrossBorder
- Sydney Sloan, CMO of SalesLoft
- Gordana Vuckovic, EVP of Global Sales at Contentstack
- Colleen Matthews, Senior Director of Channel at Armis Security

title: Case Study: What's Your Company's Community Strategy?
description:
Creating a community can be an excellent strategy for any organization. But you need to approach community creation as a business strategy, not just a marketing or support tactic.

Lumity, an end-to-end benefits solution, identified key gaps in existing communities for HR professionals. They wanted to fill these gaps, be of service to the professionals who take care of their people, and raise awareness of their modern approach to benefits. The company partnered with Hivebrite, an all-in-one community management platform to launch and manage its community.

Join Tracy Hill, Sr. Employee Benefits Communication Strategist at Lumity and Lucia Manzo, GM, Head of US Operations at Hivebrite for a fireside chat to discover more about Lumity’s community journey - from an idea to a vibrant successful community.

What You’ll learn:
- How and why Lumity launched their community
- Lumity’s community expectations versus the reality
- How Lumity creates value for its community members
- Potential com …

title: Software Showcase: CrossBorder Solutions
description:
Insight Partners' "Software Showcase" series gives you a peek into the technology that powers one of our portfolio companies.

For this edition, CrossBorder Solutions, the World’s Most Advanced AI Tax Expert, will provide an overview on how they can help you master Transfer Pricing and claim your R&D tax credit.

Watch this video to learn how you can optimize your tax reporting, compliance, and planning process for a fraction of the traditional price.

title: How Insight Supports Product Leadership & Strategy
description: In this interview with Ryan Polk, the new leader of Insight Onsite's Product Center of Excellence, he shares how he supports product leaders at Insight's portfolio companies.

title: "Building an Equitable World for the Next Generation" Virtual Town Hall on Weds 10/21
description:
**Update** 

For those who missed the live event, you can view the recording here: https://vimeo.com/471459005. You can also read the highlights and key takeaways in Mercedes Bent's blogpost here: https://medium.com/lightspeed-venture-partners/building-an-equitable-world-for-the-next-generation-aa1cd627b1ee

Lightspeed and KidNation invite you to join "Building an Equitable World for the Next Generation," a virtual town hall on Weds 10/21 live-streamed on YouTube. Attendance is free and industry leaders from Chris Bridges (also known as Ludacris) to Senator Cory Booker to Dr. Regina Benjamin and more, will share and explore how we can support the next generation and dismantle inequities across industries.

title: Battery Ventures' OpenCloud 2020 - Opening Remarks and State of the OpenCloud Report
description: General Partner Dharmesh Thakker welcomes our guests (virtually) to this years' event and gives his annual State of the OpenCloud Report, which can also be found here: https://www.battery.com/powered/state-of-opencloud-2020/

title: WFH Proves The Value of Focus
description: Insight IGNITE brought together leaders of enterprise to discuss the impact of moving thousands of employees into the home.

title: The Power of Software
description: For 25 years Insight has been intensely focused on investing in transformational software companies. These are growth-stage ScaleUps with proven product market fit who are scaling their ability to bring enhanced workflow, business efficiency, novel capability, better security, stronger analytics, and so much more to their target users. The companies that Insight invests in are game changers, and because we invest across every facet of the software ecosystem, these software businesses, quite literally, impact every aspect of our lives.

title: WITH INSIGHT: Shellye Archambeau, Business Leader & Silicon Valley CEO
description: In this edition of our WITH INSIGHT speaker series, we sat down with Shellye Archambeau who discussed the challenges she faced as a young black woman, wife, and mother, managing her personal and professional responsibilities while climbing the ranks at IBM and subsequently in her roles as one of Silicon Valley’s first female African American CEOs. This conversation offers a blueprint on how to be a leader and how to achieve both personal and professional goals.

title: Accelerating Time to Value Using Lean Methodology: How Gainsight Decreased TTV by 66%
description:
COVID-19 has impacted businesses in innumerable ways. As company expectations rise, there are expectations on improving time to value to optimize for top line and bottom line expectations.

In this webinar, Pablo Dominguez, Operating Partner at Insight Partners, sits down with:
- Nick Mehta, CEO at Gainsight
- Ashvin Vaidyanathan, CCO at Gainsight
- Matt May, Founder Stratechia

During this conversation, they discuss how Gainsight incorporated Lean Operations methodologies. Lean Operations, traditionally a manufacturing tool, have been leveraged by startups and ScaleUps to streamline processes, and by applying Lean principles Gainsight was able to reduce by 66% the time it took for their clients to get to the point of first value.

title: LinkedIn LIVE: OneTrust's ScaleUp Milestone
description: Have you been thinking about the importance of trust? We have, and so has Inc. Magazine's Fastest Growing Company OneTrust. Watch Insight's ScaleUp Milestone interview with Managing Director Richard Wells and OneTrust CEO, Kabir Barday as they discuss the challenges and opportunities for ScaleUp software companies.

title: LinkedIn Live: Episerver's ScaleUp Milestone
description: Have you considered M&A as a ScaleUp strategy? We have! Today we are joined by Insight MD Ryan Hinkle and Alex Atzberger, CEO of Episerver to talk about their recent aquisition of Optimizely, and what it takes to acquire and merge two awesome companies. #ScaleUpTakeOff #Software #mergersandacquisitions

title: LinkedIn LIVE: Within3 Discusses Life Sciences
description: In this "Behind The Investment series, we are joined by Within3 CEO, Lance Hill and Insight Partners MD Adam Berger to discuss the Life Sciences sector and the critical role that communications and collaboration software plays in it. Within3 is the world leader in online communities for the healthcare market, providing mission critical online communication, collaboration, search and networking needs for health professionals and institutions. With 20 of the top 20 Pharma companies as customers, Lance's POV on the current state of the life sciences industry is a must listen.

title: SOC 2 Compliance for ScaleUps: Deep Dive & Lessons Learned
description:
Is tackling security and compliance a 2021 priority for your company? SOC 2 compliance expert and CEO of Vanta, Christina Cacioppo, is hosting a security workshop on December 3rd to give leaders an opportunity to learn and ask questions about compliance at their ScaleUp company.


What You Will Learn:
- When and why an organization should consider getting a SOC 2
- Best practices to ensure your startup is set up well for a formal audit
- SOC 2 audit timelines, cost, and overall budget
- Leveraging SOC 2 compliance to close more sales deals


Throughout the presentation, she will share feedback, advice, and handy tips from other startups that became SOC 2 compliant in 2020.

title: Software Showcase: Manage Spending with Divvy
description:
Insight Partners' "Software Showcase" series gives you a peek into the technology that powers one of our portfolio companies.


Companies are drastically changing how they manage their spending: expense reports, visibility delays, and lack of spending controls are a thing of the past. In 2018, Divvy was the first software startup to introduce a card + expense management replacement all in one. Today, Divvy is building full financial platform for expense management, spend management, and vendor management.


Join Tyler Hogge, SVP of Product, and Sterling Snow, SVP of Revenue to see how Divvy's 7,000+ are using the platform to change the way they manage their spending."

title: #ScaleUpTogether in 2021
The Role of PR in 2021
description:
In 2020, the majority of stories in the media were focused on the evolving pandemic, which made it difficult for brands to understand where their headline could fit in.


To understand what has changed in the media landscape and how ScaleUp companies can gain visibility, we have partnered with W Communications to host this expert-led webinar.


To begin, we will focus on how the priorities of journalists and publications have changed and how the PR machine has adapted to a new reality with fewer opportunities, in both outlook and scope.


Part two navigates the post-COVID news agenda. We will share how brands can use PR to provide their prospects and customers some much-needed optimism.


To conclude this webinar, we will share ideas of what PR will look like this year and how to plan against a backdrop of uncertainty. What does a robust post-pandemic plan look like? Why will flexibility, adaptability, and patience be key? Why will brands that can create moments of happiness will preva …

title: WITH INSIGHT: Jon Fortt, American Journalist & Co-Anchor of CNBC's Squawk Alley
description:
As a journalist and lifelong learner, Jon Fortt turned the tragic death of George Floyd into a channel for empowerment through education.

As a parent who needed to grapple with having “The Talk” that many Black fathers and mothers need to have with their children, Jon channeled his career superpower – the ability to turn complex issues into something relatable and understandable – to create The Course, a program to help parents, teachers, and mentors to prepare children on the Black experience in America. A curriculum that is relevant for all Americans.

Jon has interviewed Deven on CNBC Squawk Alley, where he is co-anchor, but in this WITH INSIGHT segment, the tables have been turned.

Jon’s personal experience in creating The Course, his vantage point over the DE&I efforts of the software and entrepreneurial ecosystem, and his point of view on race and opportunity in America will be discussed in this special MLK Day WITH INSIGHT fireside chat.

title: WITH INSIGHT: Shai Reshef, President of University of the People
description: Shai Reshef is the President of University of the People (UoPeople)—the world’s first tuition-free, non-profit, accredited online academic institution dedicated to opening access to higher education. Grounded in the belief that knowledge is a key ingredient of world peace, UoPeople provides access to collegiate-level studies to qualified individuals regardless of geographic, financial or societal constraints.

title: LinkedIn Live: Behind the Investment with Plume
description:
Want to learn more about our newest investment Plume, the smart home service offering for more than 170 Communications Service Providers?

In this Behind the Investment LinkedIn LIVE, hear from Co-founder & CEO Fahri Diner and Insight Managing Director Ryan Hinkle on the core capabilities of Plume, what we at Insight were so excited by, and the business ecosystem around connected homes.

title: LinkedIn Live: From Startup to ScaleUp - Sales ScaleUp Strategies
description:
Questions around sales leadership, sales compensation plans, and having the right sales resources to hit your goals?

These are the questions often asked by our portfolio of ScaleUp software companies. Operating Partner Pablo Dominguez and our Sales & Customer Success Center of Excellence work with our portfolio companies day in and day out on best practices and data-driven strategies to help sales organizations scale.

In this session, hear from Pablo on some of the key challenges software companies face on their ScaleUp journey.

title: LinkedIn Live: From Startup to ScaleUp - Talent ScaleUp Strategies
description:
Getting your talent and hiring right is one of the most critical pieces of the ScaleUp puzzle. 

In this session, hear Operating Partner and leader of the Talent Center of Excellence, Jason Ewell, detail what some of the most common talent pitfalls we see software leaders fall into on their ScaleUp journey.

title: LinkedIn Live: From Startup to ScaleUp - Marketing ScaleUp Strategies
description: Hear from Operating Partner Gary Survis on how software ScaleUps can drive impact & growth through marketing.

title: Real Talk from the Top: Celebrating Women's History Month
description: To celebrate Women's History Month, we invited the senior software leaders from our portfolio to an event that combined candid advice from female leaders and peer networking. Watch this video to hear short talks from four executives: a Board Member, a COO, CPO, and a CMO.

title: LinkedIn Live: From Startup to ScaleUp - Product & Tech ScaleUp Strategies
description:
If you’re a tech founder and product visionary, how do you know when to hire a CPO to own the customer experience and the product roadmap? If you’re a CEO with a go-to-market background, how do you know when it’s time to add a CPO to your executive team?

In this LinkedIn Live, we chat with Operating Partner Ryan Polk who answers these questions and shares the key areas of focus for scaling R&D organizations.

title: LinkedIn Live: Behind the Investment with Clarify Health
description: In our latest LinkedIn Live "Behind the Investment," hear from Clarify Health Co-Founder & CEO Jean Drouin and Insight MD Hilary Gosher on how Clarify Health Solutions plans to use the new capital to further their mission to deliver unmatched business intelligence to payers, providers, and life sciences organizations.

title: Getting Ahead of Burnout with NYT Bestselling Author
description:
In this workshop-style event, Upwork’s VP of Customer Insights and New York Times Bestselling Author, Tim Sanders, will present ideas and methods you can use to prevent and alleviate professional burnout through design thinking.

During the event, Tim will provide insights on what it takes to restore work-life integration 2021. He’ll share the latest research as well as best practices from companies and wellness advisors.

title: Supercharge Your ScaleUp with High-Performance Revenue & Cash Operations
description:
As your business is growing, all of your metrics are pointing up and to the right. While you aspire to achieve 100% YoY growth, you are starting to notice a growing problem of the “leaky bucket” with your revenue.

One method to address this is to think in terms of Revenue Operations, where you look at transaction performance, automation, and revenue recovery. With this, you may also experiment with your pricing, packaging, and payment terms to further optimize your recurring revenue.

Learn from three of our Insight Portfolio companies on how they have an integrated solution to help you achieve high performance as you continue to grow.

title: Successfully Scaling a Finance Department for an Exit (SPAC, IPO, M&A)
description:
Accounting and finance leaders at ScaleUp software companies face many challenges when it comes to working towards a successful IPO or exit. Scaling a finance department isn’t easy, and it becomes even more difficult when trying to figure out what investors are looking for in a department’s people, processes, documentation, and systems

Not to mention SPACs… just how does a finance department effectively prepare to become public in the short timeframe a SPAC acquisition allows?

Watch this webinar to hear from Insight Partners, FloQast, and E2open.

title: Investing in Diversity: Shelly Bell, Founder & CEO of Black Girl Ventures
description:
Raise your hand if you think diversity is not only a social imperative, but also critical for business success. We sure do! 

In honor of Diversity Month, watch this lively chat between Shelly Bell, Founder & CEO of Black Girl Ventures and Insight Partners Managing Director, Rachel Geller, as they discuss an investor's perspective on diversity, equity, and inclusion within their own firms and at the companies that they invest in.

title: A Roadmap to Navigating Your Future Workplace
description:
The global shift to telework that was precipitated by the COVID-19 crisis cannot be unseen. Lessons that companies and individuals have learned will remain, and will hopefully lead to better operations long term. A focus on people, policy, and technology is more important than ever. A people-centric approach is crucial in planning a return to the office.

From bringing the emerging best practices back to the workplace, to making practical changes to the space, tech and policies, to enriching your growing hybrid organization. We will explore these topics and more during our webinar.

title: The ScaleUp Guide: Integrating ESG and Purpose into Your Business
description: A special Earth Day conversation with two Insight portfolio companies that are both driving growth and purpose through ESG. Every ScaleUp should recognize the benefits of a strong purpose for their organization including employee attraction, retention, and driving performance.

title: The Importance of Brand & Thought Leadership for Software ScaleUps
description:
Marketing rhetoric tells us that 70% of B2B decisions are made before the buyer speaks to a salesperson. But how does this relate to today’s technology buying cycle? 

Watch this webinar where you'll get a first glimpse of  exclusive, independent research conducted among 819 IT security decision makers worldwide, examining how thought leadership impacts their buying decisions. You’ll hear hints and tips on how to build a thought leadership position in the market from a PR industry veteran, who’ll share her insights on how successful companies in the sector are stealing a march on their competitors.

You’ll also hear a case study on how Thycotic, a former Insight portfolio company and specialist in privilege access management, has built a leading brand position using an integrated PR and marketing strategy.

title: Making The Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion
description:
For over a year, there's been a visible shift in the number of companies who are making DE&I a priority. After the launch of Insight Partners' ScaleUp CEO DE&I Pledge on MLK Day, we are proud to see more portfolio companies take part in this commitment to change.

During this special event, you will hear from our recognized moderator and three inspiring leaders from our portfolio. They each represent companies at different stages in their DE&I journey and have unique perspectives and playbooks to share. 

Whether you're just beginning or a few steps along the way to creating a more equitable workplace, this event will provide you with practical tips and lessons learned.

title: Insight IGNITE: Power Change
FinTech: The Endgame 2021 - Opening Remarks and Keynote Presentation
description:
Battery Ventures and Barclays present FinTech: The Endgame Conference.

Opening Remarks from Scott Tobin, General Partner, Battery Ventures and Joseph Wolf, Managing Director - Research Analyst, Barclays. 

Keynote Presentation from Shiran Shalev, Principal, Battery Ventures.

title: JumpStart
description: Insight Partners, a leading global venture capital and private equity software investor, in partnership with SV Academy, the top training and coaching platform for high performance talent in sales and customer success, are pleased to announce the launch of the JumpStart program with the support of an approximately $1 million investment from Insight Partners.

title: FinTech: The Endgame 2021- Keynote Presentation by Shiran Shalev
description: Keynote Presentation from the FinTech: The Endgame Conference on June 8, 2021 by Shiran Shalev, Principal, Battery Ventures.

title: The Next Phase of Work: Conversation with Global CIO of Zoom
description:
The last year has forced a tremendous amount of rapid change in how the business world works and communicates. Everything pivoted to a remote-first environment and for many organizations, their employees, and customers this was a sudden and dramatic change.

Now we are looking at a second phase: a reorganization of how we work, where we work from, and when we work. The needs of businesses and the desires of their employees will need to be balanced to foster the best results. Talent, Transformation and Trust will all be key factors of organizations and their employees excelling and communicating in a new business environment.

Watch Zoom Global CIO, Harry Moseley, as he shares what Zoom is seeing and learning from experiences across the world. Zoom will share where they see the best opportunities to gain competitive advantages as we look to Build Forward.

title: Voices with Vision
description: On June 18th, Insight Partners hosted a digital event highlighting two investors from the Vision Capital 2020 fund to commemorate Juneteenth. Insight Partners Managing Director, Richard Wells led the discussion with Monique Woodard and McKeever Conwell, who are investing in the future of entrepreneurship and business to drive demographic change. Their personal stories are filled with grit, determination, and passion for building a more inclusive ecosystem. These are the voices with the vision to shape a more diverse future.

title: FinTech: The Endgame 2021 - The Future of Insurance: The Disruptors' Perspective
description: Daniel Schreiber, Co-Founder & CEO, Lemonade and Michelle Cheung, CFO, Next Insurance sit down with Michael Brown, General Partner, Battery Ventures at the FinTech: The Endgame Conference to talk about the future of insurance.

title: FinTech: The Endgame 2021 - Realizing the Full Promise of Blockchain & Crypto
description: At Battery & Barclay's FinTech Conference Mahesh Vellanki, Co-Founder, VP of Growth, Rally and Sam Rosenblum, Angel Investor; formerly with Polychain Capital, Coinbase sit down with Roger Lee, General Partner at Battery Ventures to discuss blockchain and crypto currency.

title: Be in the Room Where it Happens: The CMO’s Role in IPO
description:
CMOs should play a central role in the IPO process. But, they don’t always get plugged in from the beginning of the journey. From category design to corporate messaging; from selecting the right team and working with the CEO and CFO on the company’s story, the CMO is the person to help successfully create excitement around and ultimately deliver, IPO success. After all, there is no one better to tell the story of the company than the CMO.

As a CMO at a company with the potential to IPO, it can be hard to find trustworthy, experienced voices sharing the key tactics to drive a successful IPO. Generating excitement about the IPO is more than creating a killer S1 filing. CMOs should know how to connect their TAM to the company’s category and how to develop an end-to-end marketing plan for the IPO. They should also understand the strict compliance rules around marketing. Ideally, all of this should start 18 months prior to listing, and then they should be prepared to maintain the buzz for  …

title: WITH INSIGHT: EVP & Chief Corporate Affairs Officer at Pfizer
description:
Watch our host, Insight Partners Managing Director Deven Parekh, for a series of keynote speakers as we gain insight from thought leaders across the world.

Out Executive Sally Susman, EVP and Chief Corporate Officer at Pfizer will talk about personal and professional leadership through adversity in this fireside chat. She and Deven will also discuss the vaccine rollout, stakeholder communications and engagement role, and developing a strategy for corporate responsibility.

title: Tips for Activating Community to Drive Pipeline in PLG Companies
description:
Product-led marketing programs continue to increase in popularity with B2B SaaS companies. A key component of any PLG motion is building a thriving community of end users, especially for developers, to power an organic flywheel of adoption, referrals and retention.

Watch Insight Partners Marketing Center of Excellence and two community experts from Dremio and Commsor for a roundtable with best practices on community marketing and tactics on how to establish, grow, measure and convert your PLG community to the pipeline.

title: Episode 1: Managing Workforce Productivity in the Hybrid Model at Scale
description:
Rise & IGNITE connects enterprise leaders with next-gen technology solutions addressing the most current challenges organisations are facing today.

The first event in the series is on the popular topic 'Managing Workforce Productivity at Scale' with Gtmhub. In this powerful fireside chat, Gtmhub and Red Hat will share the shift leaders need to make from the old industrial, 'output-oriented' mindset to a knowledge-based, 'outcome-oriented' mindset, including the tools and frameworks necessary for organisations to deliver results in this increasingly competitive environment.

title: How Marketers Can Stay Ahead of the Privacy Legislation Wave
description:
Having gotten to grips with GDPR (2018) and CCPA (2020, marketers are now faced with a second wave of data privacy legislation in the form of CPRA and CDPA. These new bills bring with them numerous differences from their predecessors in applicability, definitions, exemptions, rights of actions, and consent. 

With this complex patchwork of legislation across geographies, we’re excited to welcome Gary Kibel of Davis & Gilbert LLP to talk through the implications to Insight portfolio companies and strategies to ensure compliance to keep ahead of the curve. He previously joined us to discuss the ramifications of CCPA and GDPR. 

Following a 101 on upcoming legislation facing marketers, Gary will be joined in discussion with Henry Jiang, Chief Information Security Officer at Diligent, and Florian Winterstein, CEO of Jedox, both Insight Portfolio companies. The panel will discuss navigating through GDPR and CCPA, best practices for ensuring a culture of compliance, and what the future holds …

title: Insight IGNITE Power Change
description:
Insight IGNITE partners with the world's innovators, connecting the best minds in business and technology. Learn how IGNITE creates these unparalleled connections between peers. 
Together we power change.

title: When to Scale Product Management To Portfolio Management
description:
Chaos, misalignment, dependencies, and resource bottlenecks are challenges that all scaling product leaders are familiar with. Great product management skills have gotten you this far. But they’re not cutting it anymore. You need portfolio management. 

In the first part of this series, Becky coves the fundamentals of product portfolio management: what it is, when you need it, and how to incorporate it into your team to accelerate product outcomes.

title: Replace Your Roadmap With A Responsive Portfolio To Drive Outcomes
description:
In the waterfall era, there was an annual planning process where business goals led to initiatives and corresponding budget allocation. In today’s fast moving world, annual planning does not meet the needs. It’s too top down, budget oriented, and does not connect engineering resources (input) and product KPIs (output) in the process.

In the third part of this series, Becky will cover how to connect annual vision with quarterly goals and weekly check-ins to allow rapid product innovation while ensuring continued improvements of existing product experience and growth.

title: Episode 2 | Third Generation Data Architecture
description:
Join us as we delve into the exciting developments and most recent trends and innovations in data infrastructure, Cloud Data Warehouses, Data Lakes, and what the future will look like in data analytics. 
You will also hear from PWC, a company with over 276,000 employees in 157 countries, on how they created a self-service data platform based on modern data infrastructure in the cloud to empower their workforce.

title: Cybersecurity Awareness Month – Rising Above the Noise & Messaging for Success
description:
Cyber risk is at an all-time high, and the threat exposure facing ScaleUps presents a very real business risk that companies are increasingly familiar with.

At the same time, the market is saturated with solutions looking to defend against attack.

To mark Cybersecurity Awareness Month we are joined by industry experts Aviv Cohen, CMO of Pentera, and Darren Guccione, CEO of Keeper. The two companies have successfully stood above the crowd to establish their position as market leaders. They will be accompanied by Insight Partners' Gary Survis.

title: Staying Ahead of the Curve in the Age of Cybersecurity
description:
The world of cybersecurity becomes more complex each year.

However, one thing remains constant: the success of each organization relies on the ability of its leaders to dynamically identify changes within the technology landscape and the data it leverages.

In this panel discussion, you will hear from cybersecurity experts on the importance of understanding your environment from data centers to the cloud, the discipline needed in your approach to maintaining authoritative knowledge over your assets, and much more!

title: 2022 Planning: Evolution of Hiring & the Workplace
description:
The workplace we once knew is no longer exists. Our kitchen tables have become our desks, new employees have been onboarded from their bedrooms, and employers have experimented with novel recruiting tactics.

Watch this expert-led conversation about how workplace and societal changes factor into 2022 planning.

title: Demystifying the (Re)Branding Process
description:
In theory, we all get the importance of a brand. It has the power to set a long-term vision for success, get customers on your side, and rally employees around the same goal. When branding is prioritized along with acquisition efforts and product development, it can create a flywheel effect that builds momentum across your ecosystem. But the process of branding and rebranding can feel nebulous and daunting for companies of all sizes - especially startups.

In this webinar, members of the Lightricks leadership team will share their recent experience in partnering with Big Spaceship to create a brand that would prepare their business for the next stage of growth. This process has enabled Lightricks to establish a brand that connects different products in their ecosystem, sets them apart within the landscape, and aligns the whole organization toward the future.

title: Battery Ventures 2021 OpenCloud Presentation
description:
At Battery Ventures annual OpenCloud Summit on Nov 3, 2021, General Partner Dharmesh Thakker presented his team's annual OpenCloud Report. 

Created by Dharmesh Thakker, Chiraag Deora, Danel Dayan, Jason Mendel and Jack Mattei. You can find the full report here: https://www.battery.com/opencloud-2021/

title: OpenCloud 2021: Designing Products for Commercialization with Armon Dadgar, HashiCorp
description: At Battery Ventures OpenCloud Summit on Nov 3, 2021 Armon Dadgar, CTO & Co-Founder of HashiCorp presented his take on designing products for commercialization, and answered some questions from the audience with Battery's Danel Dayan.

title: OpenCloud 2021: Accelerating Growth with Culture Driven Sales with Kelly Breslin Wright, Gong
description: At Battery Ventures OpenCloud Summit on Nov 3, 2021 Kelly Breslin Wright, President & COO of Gong presented her 10 tips of accelerating growth with culture driven sales, and answered some questions from the audience with Battery's Bill Binch.

title: OpenCloud 2021: Marketing and Demand-Gen in a Product-Led World, Jeff Yoshimura, Snyk
description: At Battery Ventures OpenCloud Summit on Nov 3, 2021 Jeff Yoshimura, CMO & Customer Experience Officer of Snyk presented his take on marketing and demand-gen in a product-led world, and answered some questions from the audience with Battery's Rene Bonvanie, former CMO of Palo Alto Networks.

title: OpenCloud 2021: Driving Customer Success as a Growth Function, Hatim Shafique, Databricks
description: At Battery Ventures OpenCloud Summit on Nov 3, 2021 Hatim Shafique, Chief Customer Officer of Databricks presented his take on driving customer success as a growth function, and answered some questions from the audience with Battery's Chiraag Deora.

title: From Serving to Software: Celebrating National Veteran’s Day
description:
To honor National Veteran's Day, Insight Partners hosted an inspiring event featuring distinguished officers from our Defense Ventures Fellows program, which drives innovation and collaboration across software companies, VC firms, and the military. 

During the event, each speaker shared their experiences and stories from serving in the military and working in technology. Their unique perspectives and skillsets emphasize why veterans are valuable employees at any software company.

title: The State of Marketplaces 2021
description:
Battery Ventures' annual State of Marketplaces report presented by General Partner Roger Lee. 

Report by: Roger Lee, Justin Da Rosa, Courtney Chow and Avik Wadhwa.
You can find the full report here: https://www.scribd.com/document/539222898/Battery-Ventures-State-of-Marketplace-Report-2021

title: The Two Most Important Emotions to Balance as a Founder with Gusto's Josh Reeves
description:
Joshua Reeves, co-founder, and CEO of Gusto. title: Insight Partners LinkedIn Live: Building a BIG Brand
description:

Insight SVP of Marketing, Meg Fitzgerald, gives us some tips in this LinkedIn Live.

title: The Power of Smarter Infrastructure with Samsara's Sanjit Biswas
description:
Are you using technology reactively or proactively? 

Sanjit Biswas, co-founder and CEO of Samsara, believes when used as a proactive tool, technology can be used to "change outcomes." In this video, Sanjit talks about Samsara's mission, the power of smarter infrastructure, the importance of having an aligned partner with shared values, and growth as a never-ending journey, where culture is the scalable product.

Samsara is the pioneer of the Connected Operations Cloud, which allows businesses that depend on physical operations to harness IoT (Internet of Things) data to develop actionable business insights and improve their operations. Samsara operates in North America and Europe and serves tens of thousands of customers across a wide range of industries, including transportation, wholesale and retail trade, construction, field services, logistics, utilities and energy, government, healthcare and education, manufacturing, and the food and beverage industry. The company's mission is to …

title: The Founder Journey & Importance of Shared Values with Warby Parker's Neil Blumenthal
description:
Neil Blumenthal, co-founder, and co-CEO of Warby Parker. Neil talks about his founder journey, the importance of shared values, and Warby's leadership on responsible innovation. 

Where did the name Warby Parker come from? Learn what inspired Neil Blumenthal at the New York Public Library and what continues to drive his success. Warby Parker is a retailer of prescription glasses and sunglasses and is based in New York City. Neil has always wanted to have a positive impact on the world and solve real problems. His story is a page-turner for all entrepreneurs wanting to be profitable but also be a part of lasting change. Warby Parker has been backed by General Catalyst since 2012. 

About the series: Founder Stories is an original series by General Catalyst with the goal of celebrating businesses whose foundations are rooted in Responsible Innovation.

description:

description:
Andrew Rubin, co-founder, and CEO of Illumio. Andrew talks about Illumio's mission, building a meaningfully different cybersecurity company focused on making the world a little bit safer, and the value of partnership and radical collaboration with the General Catalyst team. Be safe most of the time and when you're not, it's not a catastrophe. That's the new-level, meaningful way Andrew Rubin, co-founder and CEO of Illumio, approaches cybersecurity. 

Illumio is a business data center and cloud computing security company based in the United States. Andrew never set out to start a company. It all started with passion and his mission-driven focus has always been at the forefront.

title: Okta CEO Todd MacKinnon | Dynamic Work
description:
On this episode of Greymatter, Okta CEO and co-founder Todd McKinnon talks with Greylock partner Sarah Guo about leadership lessons for times of dramatic change, and how his team is meeting the surge in customer demand for Okta since Covid-19 hit. Todd, who left his job leading engineering at Salesforce in 2009 to start Okta, a Greylock portfolio company, reflects on the platform shifts that convinced him to take the leap, the parallels he sees today, and what's next for Okta. Finally, for over a year predating the pandemic, Todd has been a proponent of the nuanced “dynamic work" (rather than fully remote work). He explains that philosophy and shares Okta’s approach to talent. This episode is part of Greymatter's #WorkFromAnywhere series hosted by Greylock partners Sarah Guo and David Thacker.

title: Cloudflare's Michelle Zatlyn on Being Cyber Stewards
description:
The vastness of the internet, as an entity, can be difficult to put into perspective. Cloudflare, however, has a clear sense of its scope, as it handles roughly 20-percent of internet traffic. To frame it with another stat: More than 70 billion cyber attacks are stopped by Cloudflare each day.
 
In this episode of Iconversations, Greylock’s Holly Rose Faith talks with Cloudflare Co-Founder, President, and COO Michelle Zatlyn about what it’s like to run a company that a massive constituent of users touch –  often without knowing it.

title: An Investor View on the Scale Up of AI: What We’ve Learned From Working With AI Scaleups
description:

Drawing on his experience working alongside software ScaleUps and major enterprises, he expounds on the artificial intelligence-related lessons learned and best practices brought to life, including the importance of explainability and the promise of next-gen MLOps stacks.

description:

Software startup Shortcut (previously named Clubhouse) built its product specifically for distributed teams, and the company had a high percentage of employees working remotely even prior to the Covid-19 pandemic. But Shortcut CEO and co-founder Kurt Schrader said the shift to 100% remote work has provided fresh insight into the need for more and better tools that effectively recreate the ambient intelligence of working in an office. Kurt sat down with Greylock general partner Sarah Guo to discuss how the company is internally adapting to remote-first, how usage patterns are changing among their customers, and how Shortcut is thinking about the next phase of product development.

title: Gretel.ai | Making Data Work
description:
In today’s largely cloud-native world, having access to real world data is critical in order for organizations to derive meaning that drives innovation. Yet most organizations are still contending with inadequate tools that enable them to safely share, collaborate, and build with data. What’s more, many businesses lack the engineering resources to develop workarounds in the form of anonymized data sets or synthetic datasets that can be used to run powerful tests. Ali Golshan, the CEO and co-founder of Gretel.ai, says that dynamic has put the majority of businesses and organizations at a disadvantage when it comes to innovation, which is exactly where Gretel.ai comes in. The company, which was founded in 2019, aims to be the “GitHub of data,” stepping into to provide tools for data similar to the way the open platform effectively democratized building with code. 

You can read a transcript from this episode here: greylock.com/greymatter/making-data-work/

title: Quora | Becoming a Remote-First Company
description:
Prior to the COVID-19 pandemic, tech startup Quora had a strong office culture and discouraged employees from working remotely most of the time. But once the company had no choice, Quora CEO and co-founder Adam D'Angelo says they discovered the benefits of working from anywhere far outweigh the drawbacks. In late June, Quora announced it would become a remote first company. Adam discusses the decision with Greylock partner David Thacker. This episode is part of Greymatter's #WorkFromAnywhere series hosted by David and fellow Greylock partners Sarah Guo.

Kenneth joined Greylock general partner Reid Hoffman as part of our Iconversations speaker series to discuss responsible innovation, what leadership looks like in times of crisis, and the reinventive potential of technology.

title: Okta's Frederic Kerrest on Instructive Experiences
description:
There are a million different ways things can go wrong when running a startup. Most founders learn the hard way.  Frederic Kerrest’s experience was no different. The early days of Okta, which he co-founded with Todd McKinnon in 2009, were rife with challenges. From flawed go-to-market strategies and missed sales targets to struggles with hiring, Kerrest and McKinnon dealt with it all. On top of it all, it was in the midst of the Great Recession. 
That experience is why Kerrest wrote Zero to IPO, a collection of some of the best actionable advice from some of the world’s most influential entrepreneurs. The book, which was published earlier this year, details his early days at Okta as well as those of other iconic entrepreneurs. 

As part of our Iconversations speaker series, Kerrest joined Greylock general partner Sarah Guo to discuss the key themes of the book and share detailed examples of how they played out at Okta.

You can read a transcript of this interview here: https://greylock …

title: Reid Hoffman | Crisis Management
description:
Greylock general partner Reid Hoffman and his Blitzscaling co-author Chris Yey discuss the current crisis and its impact on startups. 

Entrepreneurship assumes an innate degree of optimism and perseverance. But even the most determined founders can feel subdued when faced with yet another crisis. That’s why adaptability is a startup’s strongest asset. As recent global events push us into a new era of market volatility and economic uncertainty, companies must be prepared to recalibrate their business to the new reality. Whether that means pausing their hiring plans, tempering their expansion efforts, redirecting resources, or any other number of operational activities, today’s startup leaders should have a set of defensive and offensive tactics they can quickly deploy during times of crisis. 

You can read a transcript of this episode here: https://greylock.com/greymatter/crisis-management/

title: Convoy | Transporting Innovation
description:
Convoy CEO and co-founder Dan Lewis discusses the current shipping landscape and how his company is upgrading the long-antiquated trucking industry. Convoy, which has developed a platform that puts drivers, shipping companies, and freight brokers on the grid has allowed all parties to operate more efficiently, resulting in saved costs and time as well as reducing pollution. Founded in 2015, Convoy now works with about 80,000 registered trucking companies (which collectively have some 400,000 trucks in their network), and in April raised $260 million in Series E funding. Greylock has been an investor since 2015, and general partner Reid Hoffman sits on the company’s board. 

You can read a transcript of this interview here: https://greylock.com/firm-news/convoy-transporting-innovation/

title: HashiCorp CEO David McJannet | Powering the Multi Cloud Paradigm
description:
Greylock general partner Jerry Chen speaks with HashiCorp CEO David McJannet about the proliferation of cloud services that requires a multi-cloud approach. 

Founded in 2012, HashiCorp is an provider of products that are foundational to mission-critical cloud applications and infrastructure. As such, the company has become an essential partner to numerous organizations ranging from startups to the Big 3 cloud providers. It is both a competitor and a collaborator, and is perhaps the best representation of the open-source, multi-cloud paradigm in which almost all companies now operate.

title: Reid Hoffman | Talking Politics
description:
Greylock general partner Reid Hoffman and his Blitzscaling co-author Chris Yeh discuss when, how, and why CEOs should speak publicly about political or social topics. 
Once considered strictly off limits to business leaders, speaking out about politics and social issues has become much more common. In fact, it’s now often expected for a CEO to make a statement that communicates their company’s values and position even on the most highly-charged or controversial topics. But getting it right requires careful consideration, as Reid and Chris discuss in detail. 

This conversation was recorded in 2020. You can read an essay from the conversation here: https://greylock.com/greymatter/talking-politics/

title: Reid Hoffman | The Startup Pivot
description:
Greylock general partner Reid Hoffman shares his experience during PayPal's numerous pivots, and outlines how pivots have built some of the iconic tech companies in modern history. Hoffman describes how pivots are an integral part of the entrepreneurial process for startups: Whether you're pivoting in the early days because you haven't yet found product-market fit, or you're pivoting by reinventing yourself later on, all companies – if they're going to become and stay successful – are going to have to pivot.

You can read an essay based on this interview here: https://greylock.com/greymatter/reid-hoffman-the-startup-pivot/

title: Reid Hoffman | Myths About Failure
description:
Greylock general partner and LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman and his Blitzscaling co-author Chris Yeh discuss one the most common outcomes of startups: Failure. But although failure is often the default state for startups, it is neither inevitable nor is it necessarily the end of the story. Even if you are able to bring yourself to look failure in the eye, you can take steps to maximize your chance of success. And even if you fail despite your best efforts, if you behave ethically and demonstrate that you've learned from the mistakes you might have made along the way, failure is definitely not the end. In fact, it may be the beginning.

You can read the essay based on this conversation here:  https://greylock.com/greymatter/reid-hoffman-myths-about-failure/

title: Solv CEO Heather Fernandez | Purpose into Action
description:
Solv CEO and co-founder Heather Fernandez talks with Greylock marketing partner Elisa Schreiber about a unique fundraising strategy Solv undertook to add more women investors to the company's cap table. In late 2021, Solv was wrapping up its Series C round when Fernandez was encouraged by longtime investor and friend Kara Norton (Upfront Ventures) to launch a special purpose vehicle (SPV) aimed solely at women investors. Within 10 days, the SPV raised $3.5M from 75 women investors, 60% of whom were women of color and a majority were first-time investors. Fernandez and Schreiber discuss the process and provide a playbook for other entrepreneurs.

You can read a transcript of this conversation here: https://greylock.com/greymatter/purpose-into-action/

title: Reid Hoffman | Building Ecosystems of Adaptability
description:
Recorded in 2021. 

This episode of Greymatter features Reid Hoffman in conversation with Peter High, president of business and IT strategy firm Metis Strategy.
In the context of the current pandemic and economic crisis, Reid and Peter discuss strategies and insights for entrepreneurs on building, developing and strengthening their ecosystem (while offering the same level of support and insight back); the importance of co-design in go-to-market strategy; how blitzscaling applies to large companies; and how the pandemic has caused previous market failures to move to market readiness. title: Reid Hoffman | How to Decide
description:
Greylock general partner Reid Hoffman and his Blitzscaling co-author Chris Yeh discuss one of the most critical (yet often under-analyzed) aspects of entrepreneurship: decision-making. As Hoffman and Yeh discuss, there are actually many things entrepreneurs can do to improve their decision-making skills.  The central skill is learning how to be quick and decisive, and to adjust your course to avoid the worst of the mines. This episode was recorded in 2021.
You can read the essay based on this discussion here: 
https://greylock.com/greymatter/how-to-decide/

title: Reid Hoffman | Choosing Bad Competition
description:
If you can find a valuable market which has been overlooked, or where your competitors are lazy or stuck in their ways, you can beat that competition, no matter how big or rich those other players might be. Greylock general partner Reid Hoffman and his Blitzscaling co-author Chris Yeh discuss why entrepreneurs are far better off pursuing a high-value opportunity with bad competition over a low-value opportunity with no competition, highlighting case studies of SpaceX, Tesla, Virgin Atlantic and LinkedIn. This podcast is the first in a multi-part installment looking at the fundamental laws of entrepreneurship.

You can read the essay based on this conversation here: https://greylock.com/greymatter/choosing-bad-competition/

title: Maya Frai | The Design-First Approach
description:
Greylock investor Maya Frai outlines her perspective on design-centered products, which she believes is the now overarching driver of innovation in several industries including commerce, social, saas, web3, and more. Based on her experience on product teams at Google, Facebook, and Rent the Runway, Maya believes technology that puts people at the center are often the most successful. 

You can read the essay that inspired this conversation here: https://greylock.com/greymatter/the-design-first-approach/

title: MLT CEO John Rice | Accelerating Change
description: The technology industry is home to an unacceptable paradox: the sector is both the epicenter of wealth creation and wealth disparity. This gap begins in the early stages of company-building, among venture capital-backed startups and the people who found, build and invest in them. People of color have largely been left out of this group. Changing that reality is the mission of career advancement nonprofit Management Leadership of Tomorrow (MLT), which works to put people of color in leadership positions. A major part of MLT’s work is dispelling the myth that the lack of diversity in the tech industry comes from a so-called pipeline problem of talented African American, Latinx and Native American science, engineering and computer science grads. In actuality, the problem is a network gap, which is why MLT and Greylock have recently launched a new partnership to accelerate change for POC in the venture and startup ecosystem. Additionally, MLT has established a fund to provide further finan …

title: Alchemy | Bringing Web3 to the World
description:
Known as the "AWS of Web3", Alchemy's platform powers most of the top web3 applications around the world. The idea came to founders Nikil Viswanathan and Joe Lau following their own frustration when building a crypto analytics tool. Seeing that developers around the world needed a toolkit to enable the next wave of innovation, they set out to build Alchemy. Launched in 2020, the company's platform quickly became an indispensable tool for developers creating projects with blockchain technology, including the top NFT platforms such as Open Sea and Makerspace. Greylock investor Christine Kim spoke with Viswanathan for Greymatter's new crypto-focused series Mint Condition. 

You can read a transcript of the conversation here: https://greylock.com/greymatter/bringing-web3-to-the-world/

title: Reid Hoffman | Entrepreneurship Now
description:
Recorded in 2020 with Greylock general partner Reid Hoffman and his Blitzscaling co-author Chris Yeh. 

The Covid-19 pandemic changed the environment for entrepreneurship. In many ways, entrepreneurship became more challenging. But in a few ways (and for a few people), it became easier. And for all of us in the broader society, it became more important. The pandemic showed us the harsh reality of the world as it is. That new clarity may allow entrepreneurship to make more rapid progress towards how it should be.

You can read the essay based on this conversation here: https://greylock.com/greymatter/reid-hoffman-entrepreneurship-now/

title: Alice Bentinck and Matt Clifford | How To Be A Founder
description:
The “talent investor" Entrepreneur First was created with a mission to connect founders no matter where they are in the world, and recruits and backs them at the very earliest stages. By focusing on connecting individuals rather than defined teams, they've gained a unique perspective into what makes good ideas, and how the right co-founder dynamics can bring it into reality. Now, they've gathered some of their main insights into a book: "How to be a Founder: How Entrepreneurs Identify, Fund, and Launch Their Best Ideas." Bentinck and Clifford join Greylock general partner Reid Hoffman to discuss the book and their vision for the future of entrepreneurship. 

You can read a transcript of this interview here: https://greylock.com/greymatter/how-to-be-a-founder/

title: Reid Hoffman | Building A Great Startup Board Pt. 1
description:
Part one of a two-part series by Greylock general partner Reid Hoffman on strategies to build a successful startup board. Too often, the conventional wisdom imparted to entrepreneurs is to treat board meetings as a necessary evil, part of the price you pay for raising money.  True, many boards are dysfunctional, but when you build a great startup board, it will be a powerful tool that can help the CEO make the company successful.
